string.text: Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
High-capacity magazine (40 rounds)
Higher-capacity magazines means fewer reloads during combat and improves the odds of survival.
Mount a tactical rail
Allows for the installation of various optics on the weapon.
Tactical handle

Installation of a tactical handle under the barrel makes the gun easier to handle and allows the shooter to compensate for recoil more effectively. Installation also includes a replacement forend with Weaver rails, allowing for additional tactical accessories to be mounted.
Laser sight

Visually marks the weapon's point of impact in a straight line from the muzzle. Assists with target acquisition at close range where bullet deviation and trajectory drop are less of an issue. Installation does not prevent the addition of optics or a tactical flashlight.
Tactical flashlight
A long-range, narrow-field flashlight to assist with nighttime exploration and eliminates the need to hold one separately. Installation does not prevent the addition of a laser sight.
Lightweight polymer stock
Replacing the original polymer stock with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon and helps with recoil felt by the shooter.
Revision of the feeding mechanism
The ammunition feeding assembly has been redesigned to reduce the number of jams from cartridge misfeeding or alignment issues.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Barrel re-cutting
Changing the rifling pitch in the barrel can improve muzzle velocity for a flatter bullet trajectory.
Recoil compensator
Redirecting the powder gasses to counteract the effects of muzzle climb makes recoil easier to handle for the shooter.
Balance the bolt group
Balancing of the bolt group components reduces the barrel's departure from line of sight when firing, and also reduces perceived recoil by the shooter.
Preventative maintenance package
Replacing standard parts with analogs made of high-strength alloys and applying a special coating to the moving components can significantly increase the weapon's durability.
Install a hardened extractor
Improves overall reliability of the weapon by reducing the number of common ejection issues that can occur after firing.
Lightweight alloy components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight alloys significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
